Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a burnished cream-coloured slip and with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as pressed meat for the birth [of sun] (New Year's Day) from meatstore of ka of living Ra.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 79
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393155) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393155)
